result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant here today at Collections window to apply for county appointed attorney - to return with completed Petition for Counsel, bring along SPD Financial Eligibility Worksheet and provide most recent paystub.

Defendant Deshunaro J Kirby-Robinson in court, in custody.  Attorney Kyle Olsen in court for State of Wisconsin. Defn applied for SPD and did not qualify. Defn interested in CDP. CT sets over PTC and directs defn to complete process prior to the next court date. Notice of hearing handed out in court.
Pre-trial conference on October 4, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 23, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with TTW. 
- Defendant shall not be in the State Street and Langdon area as indicated on attached map. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not be at any bar, tavern, liquor store, or other premises whose primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 5

03:31 PM Defendant in court, in custody via Zoom with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:45 am.
